metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14634 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel's create_elf_tables() function. An unprivileged local user with access to SUID (or otherwise privileged) binary could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system. Kernel versions 2.6.x, 3.10.x and 4.14.x are believed to be vulnerable. It was discovered that an integer overflow vulnerability existed in the Linux kernel when loading an executable to run. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14634` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-160-generic - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-lowlatency - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-3.13.0-160-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-160.210
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-160-generic - 3.13.0-160.210
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> "Only kernels with commit b6a2fea39318 ("mm: variable length argument support", from July 19, 2007) but without commit da029c11e6b1 ("exec: Limit arg stack to at most 75% of _STK_LIM", from July 7, 2017) are exploitable." This flaw can only be exploited on systems with greater than 32 GB of RAM

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-160.210').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
